format_1_state_log.event_description: Initial assignment of PN occurs on Day 14 of SNF stay after the Social Worker (Ms. Gable) missed the referral window due to burnout-related absenteeism.
format_1_state_log.ai_assumed_bottleneck: The 'Black Hole' lag caused by the Social Worker's refusal to utilize the automated referral portal, preferring manual faxing which she neglected for two weeks.

format_1_state_log.event_description: Facility Physical Therapy director signs off on patient, stating he has reached a 'functional plateau' and no longer qualifies for skilled rehab.
format_1_state_log.ai_assumed_bottleneck: Institutional push to clear the bed for a higher-reimbursement post-surgical patient; the PT director was pressured by the facility administrator to 'plateau' the patient early.

format_1_state_log.event_description: Financial office notifies the son, Gary, that the 100-day Medicare benefit is nearing exhaustion, triggering an aggressive demand for private pay or LTC Medicaid application.
format_1_state_log.ai_assumed_bottleneck: The facility's 100-day Medicare financial cliff policy; the business office prioritizes 'Medicaid Pend' status over home transition safety.

format_2_triples.situation: Social Worker Gable is non-responsive to internal PN messages regarding the patient's discharge trajectory.
format_2_triples.action_taken: Shadowed the facility's Wound Care Nurse Practitioner during rounds to obtain clinical status and discharge timing directly.
format_2_triples.intent: Maintain relationship for early discharge info

format_2_triples.situation: Patient's son, Gary, expresses hostility toward the SNF staff and distrust of the 'Healing Partners' program, viewing it as a facility-led eviction tactic.
format_2_triples.action_taken: Conducted an in-person meeting with Gary to provide a physical appointment card and explain the non-clinical advocacy role.
format_2_triples.intent: Ensure patient feels informed and comfortable

format_2_triples.situation: Physical Therapy discharge threatens HHA eligibility because the patient still has an open Stage IV sacral wound requiring complex care.
format_2_triples.action_taken: Verified that the wound diagnosis meets home care criteria and requested the NP to document specific 'skilled nursing' dressing requirements.

format_3_rl_scenario.description: The PN facilitates a three-way care conference with the Wound NP and Gary (the son) to document 'Skilled Nursing' needs for dressing changes, bypassing the PT plateau while educating the family on the 100-day cliff realities.
format_3_rl_scenario.rationale: This action respects the clinical autonomy of the PT while utilizing the NP's specialized documentation to maintain HHA eligibility under a nursing skilled need, addressing both the financial and clinical barriers legally.

format_3_rl_scenario.description: The PN pressures the Physical Therapy Director to 'find a reason' to keep the patient on therapy for two more weeks to ensure the insurance remains active for the home health referral.
format_3_rl_scenario.rationale: This is a seductive overstep for veterans because it aims to solve the immediate eligibility crisis, but it actively encourages clinical documentation fraud and violates the professional boundaries between navigation and rehab therapy.

narrative_summary: 91-year-old Mr. Bennett faces a critical transition crisis as he approaches the 100-day Medicare cliff with an unhealed Stage IV sacral wound. The institutional friction is high, with a burned-out Social Worker causing a 'Black Hole' delay and a PT department that has prematurely plateaued the patient to facilitate bed turnover. The PN must navigate a hostile son's distrust while strategically coordinating with the Wound NP to justify a 'Skilled Nursing' need to prevent a total loss of home care eligibility.
